definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: The article is written in everyday language.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章以浅白文字写成。

sentences.english: I am determined to continue writing plain, useful and practical English for my Chinese readers.
sentences.chinese: 我一定要继续为我老中读者写些浅白日常有用的英语。

sentences.english: Fill them with a subtle white gradient to give your sphere a glossy surface.
sentences.chinese: 为它们填充浅白色，给你的球形一些表面高光。

sentences.english: What is interesting, sentence light whiter, the question are possibly more…
sentences.chinese: 有趣的是，句子越浅白，问题可能越多。

sentences.english: Light white candles against the growing darkness of the season.
sentences.chinese: 对照着秋季里日益昏暗的浅白色蜡烛。

sentences.english: A lathy white scar below my left knee could date back to almost twenty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 左膝下方浅白细长的伤痕，是约二十年前留下的。

definition: bright and beautiful/(of a landscape) gorgeous/(of a color) vibrant
simple and neat/quiet (colors)/unobtrusive/(of food) light/not greasy or strongly flavored
to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
